712529f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 1st Avenue
712529f-a.text:
39th Street, north side, west from clearing between First and
Second Avenues.
September, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712524f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712524f-a.text:
East 39th Street, west from First Avenue, showing
mainly the north side of this thoroughfare. At the
left is the northerly side of the Eleto Warehouse,
the Dnited Parcel 3ervice center. The row of tene--
mehts at the right are to be demolished. Tfiese are
absent in View 2. Opened to view are the 10 East
4Oth Street, the 50 East 40th Street, the Lefcourt
Colonial, the Lincoln and the Chanin Buildings.
July 23, 1939
October 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712526f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 1st Avenue
712526f-a.text:

NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712531f-b.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 1st Avenue
712531f-b.text:
(1)
East 39th Street, north side, between First and Second Aves,, and
showing Tudor City Buildings across empty lots at this point.
April 6, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at an earlier date, showing a closer view of the cleared area,
as seen from 30l East 38th Street, at the N.E. corner of Second Ave. At
the extreme right is shown the New York Edison Co. power plant, on the east
side of First Ave. from East 39th to East A0th Streets.
September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sgerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712527f-b.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - 1st Avenue

321-345 East 39th Street, north side, towards First Avenue, rear
view.
August 16, 1929.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same. Note the plant of the New York Steam Corporation on
the East River at East 35th Street.
September 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
